shortDescription: Easily implement human review of ML predictions
detailDescription: Amazon Augmented AI (Amazon A2I) enables you to build the workflows required for human review of ML predictions. Amazon A2I brings human review to all developers, removing the undifferentiated heavy lifting associated with building human review systems or managing large numbers of human reviewers.

items.name: Developer Guide

items.description: A GitHub repository of example task UIs built using HTML crowd elements.

items.name: Jupyter Notebook Demos

shortDescription: Build, deploy, and manage APIs
detailDescription: Amazon API Gateway enables you to create and deploy your own REST and WebSocket APIs at any scale. You can create robust, secure, and scalable APIs that access Amazon Web Services or other web services, as well as data that’s stored in the AWS Cloud. You can create APIs to use in your own client applications, or you can make your APIs available to third-party app developers.

shortDescription: No-code integration for SaaS apps and AWS services
detailDescription: Amazon AppFlow is a fully managed API integration service that you use to connect your software as a service (SaaS) applications to AWS services, and securely transfer data. Use Amazon AppFlow flows to manage and automate your data transfers without needing to write code.

shortDescription: Stream desktop applications securely to a browser
detailDescription: Amazon AppStream 2.0 is a fully managed, secure application streaming service that lets you stream desktop applications to users without rewriting applications. AppStream 2.0 provides users with instant access to the applications that they need with a responsive, fluid user experience on the device of their choice.

shortDescription: Query data in Amazon S3 using SQL
detailDescription: Amazon Athena is an interactive query service that makes it easy to analyze data in Amazon S3 using standard SQL. Athena is serverless, so there is no infrastructure to setup or manage, and you pay only for the queries you run. To get started, simply point to your data in S3, define the schema, and start querying using standard SQL.

shortDescription: High performance managed relational database engine
detailDescription: Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) is a web service that makes it easier to set up, operate, and scale a relational database in the cloud. It provides cost-efficient, resizeable capacity for an industry-standard relational database and manages common database administration tasks. Amazon Aurora is a fully managed relational database engine that's built for the cloud and compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL. Amazon Aurora is part of Amazon RDS.

shortDescription: Fastest serverless distributed SQL database for always available applications
detailDescription: Amazon Aurora DSQL is a serverless distributed SQL database with virtually unlimited scale, high availability, and zero infrastructure management. Aurora DSQL offers fast distributed SQL reads and writes with optimal price performance. You can use Aurora DSQL to scale to meet any workload demand without database sharding or instance upgrades. With its active-active distributed architecture, Aurora DSQL ensures strong data consistency designed for 99.99% single-Region and 99.999% multi-Region availability. The serverless design removes the operational burden of patching, upgrades, and maintenance downtime. Aurora DSQL is PostgreSQL compatible, and provides an easy-to-use developer experience.

detailDescription: Amazon Braket is a fully managed service that helps you get started with quantum computing by providing a development environment to explore and design quantum algorithms, test them on simulated quantum computers, and run them on your choice of different quantum hardware technologies.

shortDescription: Store hundreds of millions of application-specific objects
detailDescription: Amazon Cloud Directory is a cloud-native directory that can store hundreds of millions of application-specific objects with multiple relationships and schemas. Use Cloud Directory when you need a cloud-scale directory to share and control access to hierarchical data between your applications. With Cloud Directory, you can organize application data into multiple hierarchies to support many organizational pivots and relationships across directory information.

shortDescription: Global content delivery network
detailDescription: Amazon CloudFront speeds up distribution of your static and dynamic web content, such as .html, .css, .php, image, and media files. When users request your content, CloudFront delivers it through a worldwide network of edge locations that provide low latency and high performance.

shortDescription: Managed search service
detailDescription: Amazon CloudSearch is a fully managed service in the cloud that makes it easy to set up, manage, and scale a search solution for your website. Amazon CloudSearch enables you to search large collections of data such as web pages, document files, forum posts, or product information. With Amazon CloudSearch, you can quickly add search capabilities to your website without having to become a search expert or worry about hardware provisioning, setup, and maintenance. As your volume of data and traffic fluctuates, Amazon CloudSearch automatically scales to meet your needs.

items.name: Developer Guide

shortDescription: Identity management for your apps
detailDescription: Amazon Cognito handles user authentication and authorization for your web and mobile apps. With user pools, you can easily and securely add sign-up and sign-in functionality to your apps. With identity pools (federated identities), your apps can get temporary credentials that grant users access to specific AWS resources, whether the users are anonymous or are signed in.

shortDescription: Discover insights and relationships in text
detailDescription: Amazon Comprehend uses natural language processing (NLP) to extract insights about the content of documents without the need of any special preprocessing. Amazon Comprehend processes any text files in UTF-8 format. It develops insights by recognizing the entities, key phrases, language, sentiments, and other common elements in a document. Use Amazon Comprehend to create new products based on understanding the structure of documents. With Amazon Comprehend you can search social networking feeds for mentions of products, scan an entire document repository for key phrases, or determine the topics contained in a set of documents.

shortDescription: Detect and return useful information in unstructured clinical text
detailDescription: Amazon Comprehend Medical detects and returns useful information in unstructured clinical text such as physicians notes, discharge summaries, test results, and case notes. Amazon Comprehend Medical uses natural language processing (NLP) models to detect entities, which are textual references to medical information such as medical conditions, medications, or Protected Health Information (PHI).

shortDescription: Managed NoSQL database
detailDescription: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that provides fast and predictable performance with seamless scalability. You can use Amazon DynamoDB to create a database table that can store and retrieve any amount of data, and serve any level of request traffic. Amazon DynamoDB automatically spreads the data and traffic for the table over a sufficient number of servers to handle the request capacity specified by the customer and the amount of data stored, while maintaining consistent and fast performance.

shortDescription: Fully managed file system for Amazon EC2
detailDescription: Amazon EFS is a simple, serverless, elastic, set-and-forget file system that automatically grows and shrinks as you add and remove files with no need for management or provisioning. You can use Amazon EFS with Amazon EC2, AWS Lambda, Amazon ECS, Amazon EKS and other AWS compute instances, or with on-premises servers.

shortDescription: Easy-to-use scalable media transcoding
detailDescription: Amazon Elastic Transcoder lets you convert media files that you have stored in Amazon S3 into media files in the formats required by consumer playback devices. For example, you can convert large, high-quality digital media files into formats that users can play back on mobile devices, tablets, web browsers, and connected televisions.

shortDescription: In-memory caching service
detailDescription: Amazon ElastiCache makes it easy to set up, manage, and scale distributed in-memory cache environments in the AWS Cloud. It provides a high-performance, resizable, and cost-effective in-memory cache, while removing the complexity associated with deploying and managing a distributed cache environment. ElastiCache works with the Valkey, Redis OSS, and Memcached engines. To see which works best for you, see the "Comparing Valkey, Redis OSS, and Memcached self-designed caches" topic in the user guide.

shortDescription: Serverless event bus for SaaS apps and AWS services
detailDescription: Amazon EventBridge is a serverless event bus service that makes it easy to connect your applications with data from a variety of sources. EventBridge delivers a stream of real-time data from your own applications, software-as-a-service (SaaS) applications, and AWS services and routes that data to targets such as AWS Lambda. You can set up routing rules to determine where to send your data to build application architectures that react in real time to all of your data sources. EventBridge enables you to build event-driven architectures that are loosely coupled and distributed.

shortDescription: Store, catalog, prepare, and analyze financial industry data
detailDescription: Amazon FinSpace is a fully managed data management and analytics service that makes it easy to store, catalog, and prepare financial industry data at scale. Amazon FinSpace reduces the time it takes for financial services industry (FSI) customers to find and access all types of financial data for analysis.

shortDescription: Increase forecast accuracy using machine learning
detailDescription: Amazon Forecast is a fully managed deep learning service for time-series forecasting. By providing Amazon Forecast with historical time-series data, you can predict future points in the series. Time-series forecasting is useful in multiple domains, including retail, financial planning, supply chain, and healthcare. You can also use Amazon Forecast to forecast operational metrics for inventory management, and workforce and resource planning and management.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of Amazon Forecast. Includes detailed instructions for using the features and provides a complete API reference for developers.

shortDescription: Detect more online fraud faster
detailDescription: Amazon Fraud Detector is a fully managed service that makes it easy to identify potentially fraudulent online activities such as online payment fraud and creation of fake accounts. In a few steps, you can create machine learning models to identify a variety of fraudulent activities.

items.name: Overview
items.description: Understand what Amazon Fraud Detector is, how it works, and how to use it for your business use case.

items.name: Set up for  Amazon Fraud Detector
items.description: Before you get started with Amazon Fraud Detector, set up the interfaces you plan to use.

items.name: Start using Amazon Fraud Detector
items.description: Use the tutorial to get started with Amazon Fraud Detector using the AWS Management Console or the AWS SDK for Python.

sections.name: Build and train fraud detection model

items.name: Choose model type
items.description: Choose a model type for your business use case and gain insights into the dataset requirements for the model type.

items.name: Prepare dataset
items.description: Gather data from your business for your use case with the help of the insights provided for the model type you have chosen.

items.name: Define event type
items.description: Define the event that you want to use for evaluating fraud. An event is the business activity that you want to evaluate for fraud risk. An event type defines the structure of the individual event.

items.name: Store data
items.description: Store the data that you gathered from your business for the event that you want to evaluate for fraud. You can store your dataset internally with Amazon Fraud Detector or externally with Amazon S3.

items.name: Build and train a fraud detection model
items.description: Amazon Fraud Detector builds a fraud detection model using the model type that you choose for the event type that you define. The model is trained using the dataset that you prepared.

items.name: Analyze your model performance
items.description: As part of the model training, Amazon Fraud Detector generates a model performance score and other model performance metrics. Use the metrics to evaluate your model performance.

sections.name: Fraud detection, prediction, and downstream processing

items.name: Create and test detector
items.description: Create a detector by adding your trained model and rules for detecting fraud. Detector is a container that contains a fraud detection model and rules, for one specific business event you want to evaluate for fraud.

items.name: Deploy detector
items.description: Deploy detector in your production environment.

items.name: Fraud prediction
items.description: Get fraud predictions for a single event in real time or get fraud predictions offline for a set of events and then use prediction explanations to gain insight into how each variable that you use in your dataset impacts your model's fraud prediction score.

items.name: Event orchestration
items.description: Set up orchestration to send your events data to other AWS services for downstream processing of the events after fraud prediction.

items.name: Model resources
items.description: Learn how to manage the resources that the models and detectors use to evaluate your business events for fraud. Resources can be variables, rules, outcomes, labels, lists, and entities.

items.name: Security
items.description: Understand how to configure Amazon Fraud Detector to control access to resources, to protect your data, and to meet your security and compliance objectives.

items.name: Monitoring
items.description: Use monitoring tools that AWS provides to monitor Amazon Fraud Detector, report when something is wrong, and take action when appropriate.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all of the API operations for Amazon Fraud Detector, with sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web service protocols.

items.name: AWS SDK for Python (Boto3)
items.description: Describes all of the classes that are included in the Amazon Fraud Detector AWS SDK for Python (Boto3).

items.name: AWS SDK for JavaScript
items.description: Describes all API operations for the AWS SDK for JavaScript, with sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web service protocols.

items.name: Amazon Fraud Detector product page
items.description: Use the Amazon Fraud Detector product page to gain an overall understanding of the product and if it meets your business use case.

items.description: Find answers to frequently asked questions

shortDescription: Launch, run, and scale feature-rich and high-performing file systems
detailDescription: Amazon FSx makes it easy and cost effective to launch, run, and scale feature-rich, high-performance file systems in the cloud. It supports a wide range of workloads with its reliability, security, scalability, and broad set of capabilities. With Amazon FSx, you can choose between four widely-used file systems: Lustre, NetApp ONTAP, OpenZFS, and Windows File Server. Amazon File Cache is a high-speed cache on AWS that makes it easier to process file data, regardless of where the data is stored.

shortDescription: Simple, fast, cost-effective dedicated game server hosting
detailDescription: Amazon GameLift is a fully-managed service with game streaming and multiplayer game server hosting capabilities. Using the AWS global footprint and game optimized GPU instances, publishers can deploy and stream their game content in minutes, and players can start gaming in seconds without perceivable lag or having to wait for installs. With high-scaling game server and smooth gameplay streaming capabilities, Amazon GameLift helps developers to build, scale, and deliver the world's most demanding games.

items.name: Amazon GameLift Servers Hosting Developer Guide
items.description: Learn how to integrate and deploy games for hosting on Amazon GameLift Servers. The service manages game server deployment, operation, and scaling. You can deploy custom-built game servers or use Amazon GameLift Servers Realtime to configure lightweight game servers for your game.

items.name: Amazon GameLift Servers FlexMatch Developer Guide
items.description: Learn how to build custom matchmakers using Amazon GameLift Servers FlexMatch. Work with the FlexMatch rules language to fine-tune how players are matched into game sessions. Set up FlexMatch for games that use Amazon GameLift Servers managed hosting, or build a standalone FlexMatch solution to work with other hosting solutions.

items.name: Amazon GameLift Servers FleetIQ Developer Guide
items.description: Learn how to use FleetIQ with games that are already hosted on Amazon EC2 with Auto Scaling. FleetIQ optimizations for server availabililty make game hosting viable on low-cost Amazon EC2 Spot Instances.

items.name: Amazon GameLift Servers API Reference
items.description: Look up all AWS SDK operations and data types for Amazon GameLift Servers. The API supports all Amazon GameLift Servers features, including managed hosting, Realtime, FleetIQ, and FlexMatch.

items.name: AWS CLI Reference for Amazon GameLift Servers
items.description: Look up all AWS CLI commands for Amazon GameLift Servers features, including managed hosting, Realtime, FleetIQ, and FlexMatch.

items.name: SDK References
items.description: Look up complete documentation on the SDK for Amazon GameLift Servers. Use the server SDK to set up your custom-built game servers for hosting with Amazon GameLift Servers. Use the Realtime client SDK with your game clients to enable them to interact with Realtime Servers hosted on Amazon GameLift Servers.

shortDescription: High frame rate, low-latency game streaming to devices at global scale
detailDescription: Amazon GameLift Streams helps developers stream games at up to 1080p resolution and 60 frames-per-second to any device with a browser. Using AWS’s global footprint and game-optimized GPU instances, publishers can deploy and stream game content in minutes, without modifications, and players can start gaming in seconds without perceivable lag or having to wait for installs.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Learn how to upload your game and create a stream group to manage streaming capacity in multiple geographical locations, how to integrate a web client and backend server with your game to start streaming sessions, and how to monitor streaming usage and optimize your streaming solution to lower streaming capacity costs.

shortDescription: Managed threat detection service
detailDescription: Amazon GuardDuty is a continuous security monitoring service. Amazon GuardDuty can help to identify unexpected and potentially unauthorized or malicious activity in your AWS environment.

shortDescription: Automated and continual vulnerability management at scale
detailDescription: Amazon Inspector is a security vulnerability assessment service that helps improve the security and compliance of your AWS resources. Amazon Inspector automatically assesses resources for vulnerabilities or deviations from best practices, and then produces a detailed list of security findings prioritized by level of severity. Amazon Inspector includes a knowledge base of hundreds of rules mapped to common security standards and vulnerability definitions that are regularly updated by AWS security researchers.

shortDescription: Build engaging live stream experiences using IVS
detailDescription: Amazon Interactive Video Service (IVS) is a managed, live-video streaming service with both low-latency and real-time streaming capabilities. It handles everything from video ingesting and transcoding to global distribution for playback, so you can focus on building your own interactive application and audience experience. With Amazon IVS, you can stream without needing to manage or develop components on your own.

detailDescription: Amazon Kinesis makes it easy to collect, process, and analyze video and data streams in real time.

shortDescription: Build voice and text chatbots
detailDescription: Amazon Lex is an AWS service for building conversational interfaces into applications using voice and text. With Amazon Lex, the same deep learning engine that powers Amazon Alexa is now available to any developer, enabling you to build sophisticated, natural language chatbots into your new and existing applications. Amazon Lex provides the deep functionality and flexibility of natural language understanding (NLU) and automatic speech recognition (ASR) to enable you to build highly engaging user experiences with lifelike, conversational interactions and create new categories of products.

shortDescription: Launch and manage virtual private servers
detailDescription: With Amazon Lightsail and Amazon Lightsail for Research, everyone—including developers, academics, and researchers—can get started with Amazon Web Services (AWS).

shortDescription: Portfolio of modern Linux-based high performance operating systems
detailDescription: Amazon Linux is a portfolio of modern Linux-based high performance operating systems that are security-focused and stable.

shortDescription: Securely and easily add location data to applications
detailDescription: Use Amazon Location Service to easily and securely add maps, places, routes, geofences, and trackers, to your applications. With Amazon Location Service, you safeguard customer data, reduce cost, and easily integrate with other AWS services.

items.name: Maps
items.description: Amazon Location Maps lets you create beautiful map-enabled visualizations, including embedding interactive dynamic maps, or static map imagery in your apps and even layering your own data on top of the base map.

items.name: Places
items.description: Amazon Location Places enables searching and geocoding of geographic data, including addresses, points of interest, and business info such as categories, food types, brands, and opening hours.

items.name: Routes
items.description: Amazon Location Routes calculates travel routes, estimate trip time, and optimizes travel itineraries and logistics problems using up-to-date road network data, live traffic, and rich road and vehicle attributes.

items.name: Geofences
items.description: Amazon Location Geofences allows setting up and managing virtual boundaries for monitoring when devices enter or leave specific areas, useful for asset tracking and alerts.

items.name: Trackers
items.description: Amazon Location Trackers lets you track the location of devices in near real-time, visualize movements on maps, and integrate tracking data with geofences for automated alerts.

items.name: Authentication
items.description: Learn how to authenticate with Amazon Location through API keys, IAM roles, and Amazon Cognito, ensuring secure access to your location-based applications.

items.name: Amazon Location SDKs
items.description: Access SDKs that offer programmatic interaction with Amazon Location, allowing integration of location-based services into apps using various programming languages.

items.name: API reference
items.description: The Amazon Location API offers programmatic access to location-based features such as maps, geocoding, geofences, tracking, and routing services.

items.name: CLI reference
items.description: Use the AWS CLI to manage Amazon Location resources, including commands for maps, places, geofences, trackers, and routing operations, with example usage.

items.name: Best practices
items.description: Discover best practices for optimizing your use of Amazon Location to enhance performance, ensure security, and maximize the value of your location-based solutions.

items.name: Integrations with AWS services
items.description: Learn about integrating Amazon Location with other AWS services to automate workflows and monitor your resources using tools like CloudWatch.

items.name: Security
items.description: Understand how Amazon Location approaches data security, with best practices for protecting your information and complying with privacy standards.

items.name: Samples and Demos
items.description: Access various code samples and tutorials to help you quickly learn and start building applications with Amazon Location geospatial features.

items.name: Engage with the Community
items.description: Amazon Location provides a collaborative platforms for developers to ask questions, share knowledge, and contribute to GitHub to advance their understanding of Amazon Location.

items.name: Amazon Location Pricing
items.description: Use the pricing tool to estimate costs for Amazon Location services based on projected usage, such as map requests, geofencing evaluations, and tracking updates.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Access the previous version of the Amazon Location Service developer guide for legacy documentation, practical examples, and older feature details.

shortDescription: Detect abnormal equipment behavior by analyzing sensor data
detailDescription: Amazon Lookout for Equipment uses industrial data from your equipment to detect potential failures so you can take action, such as performing maintenance before a breakdown, to avoid unplanned downtime.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of Amazon Lookout for Equipment, offers detailed instructions for using various features, and includes a complete API reference for developers.

shortDescription: Automatically detect anomalies in metrics and identify the root cause
detailDescription: Amazon Lookout for Metrics is a machine learning service that helps you continuously find anomalies in business and operational data based on the same technology used by Amazon.com. With Amazon Lookout for Metrics, no machine learning experience is required.

items.name: Amazon Lookout for Metrics Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of Amazon Lookout for Metrics and detailed instructions for using its features.

items.name: Amazon Lookout for Metrics API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for Amazon Lookout for Metrics in detail.

shortDescription: Spot product defects and automate quality inspection
detailDescription: Amazon Lookout for Vision enables you to find visual defects in industrial products, accurately and at scale. It uses computer vision to identify missing components in an industrial product, damage to vehicles or structures, irregularities in production lines, and even minuscule defects in silicon wafers — or any other physical item where quality is important such as a missing capacitor on printed circuit boards.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Describes all Amazon Lookout for Vision concepts and provides instructions on using the various features with the console, command line interface, and the AWS SDK.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for Amazon Lookout for Vision in detail.

shortDescription: A free cross-platform 3D game engine (binaries no longer offered)
detailDescription: Amazon Lumberyard is no longer offered. Customers should instead use Open 3D Engine (O3DE), the official successor to Lumberyard. Open 3D Engine is a cross-platform, open-source game engine developed by a community (including Amazon and others), available under the Apache 2.0 license.

items.name: Open 3D Engine
items.description: Open 3D Engine is an open-source, Apache 2.0-licensed simulation engine for building games and 3D worlds, maintained by a community of contributors.

items.name: Migrate from Lumberyard to Open 3D Engine
items.description: The Open 3D Engine project keeps a contributor-maintained guide to help developers using Amazon Lumberyard move to Open 3D Engine.

items.name: Amazon Lumberyard documentation archive
items.description: Access an archive of the Amazon Lumberyard documentation through our GitHub mirror.

shortDescription: Learn about Amazon machine learning services
detailDescription: Regardless of your experience, Amazon provides services that you can use to create machine learning solutions for a wide range of industries.

items.name: Amazon Sagemaker
items.description: Use Amazon SageMaker to quickly build and train and deploy machine learning models, including Foundation Models for generative AI solutions.

items.name: Amazon Textract
items.description: Amazon Textract enables you to add document text detection and analysis to your applications.

items.name: Amazon Comprehend
items.description: Amazon Comprehend uses natural language processing (NLP) to extract insights about the content of documents.

items.name: Amazon A2I
items.description: Amazon Augmented AI (Amazon A2I) enables you to build the workflows required for human review of ML predictions.

items.name: Amazon Lex
items.description: Amazon Lex is an AWS service for building conversational interfaces into applications using voice and text.

items.name: Amazon Transcribe
items.description: Amazon Transcribe provides transcription services for your audio files and audio streams.

items.name: Amazon Polly
items.description: Amazon Polly is a Text-to-Speech (TTS) cloud service that converts text into lifelike speech.

items.name: Amazon Kendra
items.description: Amazon Kendra is a search service, powered by machine learning, that enables users to search unstructured text using natural language.

items.name: Amazon Personalize
items.description: Real-time personalization and recommendations, based on the same technology used at Amazon.com.

items.name: Amazon Translate
items.description: Amazon Translate is a neural machine translation service for translating text to and from English across a breadth of supported languages.

items.name: Amazon Forecast
items.description: Amazon Forecast is a fully managed deep learning service for time-series forecasting.

items.name: Amazon Fraud Detector
items.description: Amazon Fraud Detector is a fully managed service that helps you detect suspicious online activities.

items.name: Amazon Lookout for metrics
items.description: Amazon Lookout for Metrics is a machine learning service that helps you continuously find anomalies in business and operational data based on the same technology used by Amazon.com.

items.name: Amazon Devops Guru
items.description: Amazon DevOps Guru generates operational insights using machine learning to help you improve the performance of your operational applications.

items.name: Amazon Code Guru Reviewer and Amazon Code Guru Profiler
items.description: CodeGuru provides intelligent recommendations for improving application performance, efficiency, and code quality in your applications.

items.name: Amazon Rekognition
items.description: Learn how to find objects, faces, in images and videos Amazon Rekognition. Use Amazon Custom Labels to create train your own computer vision model.

items.name: Amazon Lookout for Equipment
items.description: Amazon Lookout for Equipment uses industrial data from your equipment to detect potential failures so you can take action, such as performing maintenance before a breakdown, to avoid unplanned downtime.

items.name: Amazon Lookout for Vision
items.description: Amazon Lookout for Vision enables you to find visual defects in industrial products, accurately and at scale.

items.name: Amazon Monitron
items.description: Amazon Monitron is an end-to-end system that detects abnormal behavior in industrial machinery enabling you to implement predictive maintenance and reduce unplanned downtime.

items.name: AWS Panorama
items.description: Improve your operations with computer vision at the edge

items.name: AWS Deep Learning Containers
items.description: AWS Deep Learning Containers (Deep Learning Containers) are a set of Docker images for training and serving models in TensorFlow, TensorFlow 2, PyTorch, and MXNet.

items.name: AWS Deep Learning AMIs
items.description: The AWS Deep Learning AMIs equip machine learning practitioners and researchers with the infrastructure and tools to accelerate deep learning in the cloud at any scale.

items.name: Apache MXNet on AWS
items.description: Apache MXNet (MXNet) is an open source deep learning framework that allows you to define, train, and deploy deep neural networks on a wide array of platforms, from cloud infrastructure to mobile devices.

items.name: Amazon Elastic Inference
items.description: Amazon Elastic Inference is a service that allows you to attach low-cost GPU-powered acceleration to many Amazon machine instances in order to reduce the cost of running deep learning inference by up to 75%.

items.name: Amazon Comprehend Medical
items.description: Amazon Comprehend Medical detects and returns useful information in unstructured clinical text such as physicians notes, discharge summaries, test results, and case notes.

items.name: AWS HealthLake
items.description: AWS HealthLake is a Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR)-enabled patient Data Store. You can use AWS HealthLake to bring data from diverse sources into standard FHIR R4 format.

items.name: AWS HealthOmics
items.description: AWS HealthOmics stores, transforms, and analyze genomic and other biological data to generate health insights and advance scientific discoveries.

items.name: AWS DeepComposer

items.name: AWS DeepLens
items.description: Learn the basics of deep learning through computer vision projects, tutorials, and real world, hands-on exploration.

items.name: AWS DeepRacer
items.description: Get hands-on with machine learning through a 3D racing simulator, fully autonomous 1/18th scale car, and global racing league.

items.description: Describes all the API operations for Amazon Machine Learning in detail. Also provides sample requests and responses for supported web service protocols.

shortDescription: Discover and protect your sensitive data at scale
detailDescription: Amazon Macie is a fully managed data security and data privacy service. Macie uses machine learning and pattern matching to help you discover, monitor, and protect your sensitive data in Amazon S3.

detailDescription: Amazon Managed Blockchain (AMB) helps you to easily create, manage, and access blockchain infrastructure using AMB Access and query data from supported public blockchain networks using AMB Query.

shortDescription: Visualize and analyze your operational data at scale
detailDescription: Amazon Managed Grafana is a fully managed and secure data visualization service that you can use to instantly query, correlate, and visualize operational metrics, logs, and traces from multiple data sources. Amazon Managed Grafana makes it easy to deploy, operate, and scale Grafana, a widely deployed open-source data visualization tool popular for its extensible data support.

shortDescription: Process and analyze streaming data using Apache Flink
detailDescription: With Amazon Managed Service for Apache Flink, you can use Java, Scala, or SQL to process and analyze streaming data. The service enables you to author and run code against streaming sources to perform time-series analytics, feed real-time dashboards, and create real-time metrics.

shortDescription: Highly available, secure, and managed monitoring for your containers
detailDescription: Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus provides highly available, secure, and managed monitoring for your containers. It automatically scales as your ingestion and query needs grow, and gives you access to remote write metrics from existing Prometheus servers and to query metrics using PromQL.

shortDescription: Redis-compatible, durable, in-memory database service
detailDescription: Amazon MemoryDB is a fully managed, Valkey- and Redis OSS-compatible, in-memory database. It delivers ultra-fast performance and Multi-AZ durability for modern applications built using microservices architectures.

items.description: Describes the command line interface for Amazon MemoryDB in detail. Provides basic syntax, options, and usage examples for each command.

shortDescription: Reduce unplanned equipment downtime with predictive maintenance and ML
detailDescription: Amazon Monitron is an end-to-end system that detects abnormal behavior in industrial machinery enabling you to implement predictive maintenance and reduce unplanned downtime.

detailDescription: Amazon MQ is a managed message broker service that makes it easy to set up and operate message brokers in the cloud. Amazon MQ provides interoperability with your existing applications and services. Amazon MQ works with your existing applications and services without the need to manage, operate, or maintain your own messaging system.

detailDescription: Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK) is a fully managed service that makes it easy for you to build and run applications that use Apache Kafka to process streaming data.

shortDescription: Fully managed graph database service
detailDescription: Amazon Neptune is a fast, reliable, fully managed graph database service that makes it easy to build and run applications that work with highly connected datasets. The core of Neptune is a purpose-built, high-performance graph database engine that is optimized for storing billions of relationships and querying the graph with milliseconds of latency. Neptune supports two popular property-graph query languages, Gremlin and openCypher, as well as SPARQL for RDF data. These can help you build queries that efficiently navigate highly connected datasets. You can use Neptune for graph use cases such as recommendation engines, fraud detection, knowledge graphs, drug discovery, and network security.

shortDescription: ChatOps for AWS
detailDescription: Amazon Q Developer in chat applications (previously AWS Chatbot) enables you to monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize your AWS resources with a generative AI-powered assistant in Microsoft Teams and Slack. Discover more about your AWS resources, collaboratively troubleshoot operational events, run AWS CLI commands, and remediate issues by chatting with Amazon Q Developer directly from your chat channels. Customize your experience by creating contextual action buttons for notifications and command aliases that represent CLI commands. Amazon Q Developer is also available as a delivery channel to receive notifications configured from AWS User Notifications.

It is optimized for datasets ranging from a few hundred gigabytes to a petabyte or more and costs less than $1,000 per terabyte per year, a tenth the cost of most traditional data warehousing solutions.

shortDescription: Analyze image and video
detailDescription: Amazon Rekognition makes it easy to add image and video analysis to your applications. You just provide an image or video to the Amazon Rekognition API, and the service can identify objects, people, text, scenes, and activities. It can detect any inappropriate content as well. Amazon Rekognition also provides highly accurate facial analysis and facial recognition. With Amazon Rekognition Custom Labels, you can create a machine learning model that finds the objects, scenes, and concepts that are specific to your business needs.

shortDescription: Set up, operate, and scale a relational database in the cloud
detailDescription: Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) is a web service that makes it easier to set up, operate, and scale a relational database in the cloud. It provides cost-efficient, resizeable capacity for an industry-standard relational database and manages common database administration tasks. Amazon Aurora is a fully managed relational database engine that's built for the cloud and compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL. Amazon Aurora is part of Amazon RDS.

Collaborate and build faster with Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio using familiar AWS tools for model development, generative AI, big data processing, and SQL analytics, accelerated by Amazon Q Developer, the most capable generative AI assistant for software development. Access all of your data whether it's stored in data lakes, data warehouses, third party, or federated sources with Amazon SageMaker Lakehouse. detailDescription: Amazon Simple Workflow Service (Amazon SWF) makes it easy to build applications that coordinate work across distributed components. In Amazon SWF, a task represents a logical unit of work that is performed by a component of your application. Coordinating tasks across the application involves managing intertask dependencies, scheduling, and concurrency in accordance with the logical flow of the application. Amazon SWF gives you full control over implementing tasks and coordinating them without worrying about underlying complexities such as tracking their progress and maintaining their state.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of Amazon SWF and includes detailed development instructions for using the various features.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for Amazon SWF in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Looks closely at the AWS Flow Framework for Java, which is a programming framework that enables you to build asynchronous and distributed applications with Amazon Simple Workflow Service using the features of Java.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for the AWS Flow Framework for Java in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

shortDescription: Extract text and data from documents
detailDescription: Amazon Textract enables you to add document text detection and analysis to your applications. You provide a document image to the Amazon Textract API, and the service detects the document text. Amazon Textract works with formatted text and can detect words and lines of words that are located close to each other. It can also analyze a document for items such as related text, tables, key-value pairs, and selection elements.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Use Amazon Textract to detect and analyze text in your documents.

shortDescription: Fully managed time series database
detailDescription: With Amazon Timestream for LiveAnalytics, you can easily store and analyze sensor data for IoT applications, metrics for DevOps use cases, and telemetry for application monitoring scenarios such as clickstream data analysis. Amazon Timestream for InfluxDB is a managed time-series database engine that makes it easy for application developers and DevOps teams to run InfluxDB databases on AWS for real-time time-series applications using open-source APIs. With Amazon Timestream for InfluxDB, it is easy to set up, operate, and scale time-series workloads that can answer queries with single-digit millisecond query response time.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of Amazon Timestream for LiveAnalytics, includes detailed instructions for using the various features, and provides a complete API reference for developers.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of Amazon Timestream for InfluxDB, includes detailed instructions for using the various features.

items.name: API reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for Amazon Timestream for InfluxDB in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

shortDescription: Automatic speech recognition
detailDescription: Amazon Transcribe provides transcription services for your audio files and audio streams. It uses advanced machine learning technologies to recognize spoken words and transcribe them into text.

items.name: Amazon Transcribe Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of Amazon Transcribe and offers detailed instructions for using the various transcription features.

items.name: AWS HealthScribe Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS HealthScribe, which has clinical note generation and transcription capabilities specifically designed for medical consultations.

items.name: Amazon Transcribe Medical Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of Amazon Transcribe Medical, which has transcription features specifically designed for medical professionals.

items.name: Call Analytics Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of Amazon Transcribe Call Analytics, which has transcription features specifically designed for call center audio.

items.description: Describes all Amazon Transcribe API operations in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

items.name: CLI Reference

shortDescription: Natural and fluent language translation
detailDescription: Amazon Translate is a neural machine translation service for translating text to and from English across a breadth of supported languages. Powered by deep-learning technologies, Amazon Translate delivers fast, high-quality, and affordable language translation. It provides a managed, continually trained solution so you can easily translate company and user-authored content or build applications that require support across multiple languages. The machine translation engine has been trained on a wide variety of content across different domains to produce quality translations that serve any industry need.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of Amazon Translate and detailed instructions for using the various features.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes the Amazon Translate API operations and parameters in detail.

shortDescription: Permissions management and authorization for custom applications
detailDescription: Amazon Verified Permissions provides customer applications with the ability to control which users can perform which actions within the application. Verified Permissions uses policies written in the Cedar policy language to describe access using the standard PARX model: principal, actions, resource, and context.

items.name: Amazon Verified Permissions User Guide
items.description: Introduces you to Amazon Verified Permissions. Explains how to create and manage authorization policies written in the Cedar policy language. Also explains how to create a schema that describes your application's authorization environment. The schema can include the principals, resources, and actions that are part of your application's operational flow. Finally, it explains how to use Verified Permissions from within your application to authorize your users' requests.

items.name: Amazon Verified Permissions API Reference
items.description: Describes the API operations for Amazon Verified Permissions in detail. It provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web service protocols.

items.name: Cedar Policy Language Reference Guide
items.description: Introduces you to the Cedar policy language. Describes the available language elements and the grammar that you use to combine them into a policy. The Cedar policy language is an open source project hosted on GitHub.

shortDescription: Isolated cloud resources
detailDescription: Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) enables you to provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud where you can launch AWS resources in a virtual network that you've defined.

detailDescription: Amazon VPC Lattice is a fully managed application networking service that you use to connect, secure, and monitor all of your services across multiple accounts and virtual private clouds (VPCs).

shortDescription: Secure enterprise document storage and sharing
detailDescription: Amazon WorkDocs is a fully managed, secure enterprise storage and sharing service with strong administrative controls and feedback capabilities that improve user productivity.

shortDescription: Secure email and calendaring
detailDescription: Amazon WorkMail is a managed email and calendaring service that offers strong security controls and support for existing desktop and mobile clients.

shortDescription: Virtual desktops in the cloud
detailDescription: Amazon WorkSpaces offers an easy way to provide a cloud-based desktop experience to your end users. Select from a choice of bundles that offer a range of different amounts of CPU, memory, storage, and a choice of applications. Users can connect from a PC, Mac desktop computer, iPad, Kindle, or Android tablet.

shortDescription: Virtual desktop infrastructure that works with third-party solutions
detailDescription: WorkSpaces Core offers managed virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) designed to work with third-party management solutions. It simplifies VDI migration by combining your existing VDI management software with the security and reliability of AWS Cloud infrastructure.

items.name: Administration Guide

shortDescription: Provide secure access to internal websites and SaaS applications
detailDescription: WorkSpaces Secure Browser is a fully managed, cloud-native, hosted browser service. End users can securely access private websites and software-as-a-service (SaaS) web applications, interact with online resources, and browse the internet from a disposable container.

detailDescription: Cost-effective, easy-to-manage thin client to securely access AWS End User Computing services.

shortDescription: Scale multiple resources to meet demand
detailDescription: AWS provides multiple services that you can use to scale your application. Auto scaling is enabled by Amazon CloudWatch and is available at no additional charge beyond the service fees for CloudWatch and the other AWS resources that you use.

shortDescription: Build internal applications to automate processes and simplify organization activities
detailDescription: AWS App Studio is a generative AI-powered service that uses natural language to create secure, enterprise-grade applications fully managed by AWS. Builders can create and deploy apps to modernize business processes such as inventory management and tracking, claims processing, and complex approvals to improve employee productivity and customer outcomes.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Learn how to use natural language and generative AI in AWS App Studio to easily build applications to automate processes and simplify organization activities.

shortDescription: Quickly create and deploy open-source blockchain frameworks on AWS
detailDescription: Use AWS Blockchain Templates to quickly create and deploy open-source blockchain frameworks on AWS, such as Ethereum and Hyperledger Fabric.

items.name: AWS Blockchain Templates Developer Guide
items.description: Helps you launch open-source blockchain networks on AWS using AWS Blockchain Templates. This guide provides architecture information, prerequisites, and instructions for using each type of template available.

shortDescription: Helping you do cryptography right, even without special expertise
detailDescription: Cryptography is hard to do safely and correctly. The AWS Crypto Tools libraries are designed to help everyone do cryptography right, even without special expertise. Our client-side encryption libraries help you to protect your sensitive data at its source using secure cryptographic algorithms, envelope encryption, and signing.

items.name: AWS Encryption SDK Developer Guide
items.description: Learn how to use the AWS Encryption SDK, a client-side encryption library for all types of data. It makes best-practice client-side encryption easier, so you can focus on the core functionality of your application. Use these libraries with any cryptographic service provider, including AWS Key Management Service or AWS CloudHSM, but the libraries do not require AWS or any AWS service.

items.name: AWS Database Encryption SDK Developer Guide
items.description: Learn how to use the AWS Database Encryption SDK, a set of software libraries that enable you to include client-side encryption in your database design. The encryption and signing features are easy to incorporate into your existing applications. Use these libraries with any cryptographic service provider, including AWS Key Management Service or AWS CloudHSM, but the libraries do not require AWS or any AWS service.

items.name: Amazon S3 Encryption Client Developer Guide
items.description: Learn how to use the Amazon S3 Encryption Client, a client-side encryption library designed especially for Amazon S3 objects. With the Amazon S3 Encryption Client, you can encrypt your Amazon S3 objects before uploading them to Amazon S3. Use these libraries with any cryptographic service provider, including AWS Key Management Service or AWS CloudHSM, but the libraries do not require AWS or any AWS service.

shortDescription: Secure, physical locations for quick transfer of data to AWS
detailDescription: AWS Data Transfer Terminal provides access to a network-ready, physical location for customers to bring their devices for near instantaneous data transfer to or from the cloud.

items.name: AWS Data Transfer Terminal User Guide
items.description: Describes key concepts for AWS Data Transfer Terminal and provides instructions for scheduling reservations and accessing secure Data Transfer Terminal locations.

shortDescription: Docker images for deep learning
detailDescription: AWS Deep Learning Containers (Deep Learning Containers) are a set of Docker images for training and serving models in TensorFlow, TensorFlow 2, PyTorch, and MXNet. Deep Learning Containers provide optimized environments with TensorFlow and MXNet, Nvidia CUDA (for GPU instances), and Intel MKL (for CPU instances) libraries and are available in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR).

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Walks through how to set up AWS Deep Learning Containers and integrate them with other services. Describes the common use cases and provides tutorials to get you working with Deep Learning Containers.

shortDescription: ML enabled musical keyboard
detailDescription: AWS DeepComposer is an artificial intelligence (AI)-enabled music keyboard that provides you with a hands-on learning experience to explore generative learning. It is integrated with AWS Machine Learning (ML) services. You can use it as a regular MIDI keyboard to play, compose, or arrange musical pieces.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS DeepComposer and provides instructions on using the various features.

shortDescription: Manage your AWS accounts as a group
detailDescription: With AWS Organizations, you can consolidate multiple AWS accounts into an organization that you create and centrally manage. You can create member accounts and invite existing accounts to join your organization. You can organize those accounts and manage them as a group. With AWS Account Management you can update the alternate contact information for each of your AWS accounts.

detailDescription: Use AWS Amplify to develop and deploy cloud-powered mobile and web applications. Amplify provides frontend libraries, UI components, and backend building for fullstack applications on AWS. Amplify Hosting provides a continuous delivery and hosting service for fullstack cloud applications.

shortDescription: Production web applications at scale made easy for developers
detailDescription: AWS App Runner is a fully managed service that makes it easy for you to deploy from source code or a container image directly to a scalable and secure web application.

shortDescription: Containerize and migrate existing applications
detailDescription: AWS App2Container (A2C) is a command-line tool for modernizing .NET and Java applications into containerized applications. Using A2C simplifies your migration tasks by performing inventory and analysis of your existing applications, creating Docker containers that include your application dependencies, and generating deployment templates based on AWS best practices with known values filled in for you. After you have reviewed your templates, A2C helps you register your containers to Amazon ECR, deploy to Amazon ECS or Amazon EKS, and build CI/CD pipelines using AWS CodeStar.

items.name: AWS App2Container User Guide
items.description: Describes key concepts of the AWS App2Container command line tool and demonstrates how to use the commands.

shortDescription: Quickly deploy application configurations to applications of any size
detailDescription: Use AWS AppConfig to quickly deploy application configurations to applications of any size. AWS AppConfig supports controlled deployments and includes built-in validation checks and monitoring.

shortDescription: Aggregate and analyze data across SaaS applications
detailDescription: AWS AppFabric is a managed service that aggregates and analyzes data across several software as a service (SaaS) applications. It breaks data silos that exist today across various applications. Security teams can use it to analyze user access and event log data and output it into a security application of choice.

items.name: Administration Guide
items.description: Describes key concepts of AppFabric and provides instructions for configuring the service.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes the API operations for AppFabric. It also provides the basic structure and elements of an API request and response.

shortDescription: Discover on-premises applications to streamline migration
detailDescription: The AWS Application Discovery Service helps systems integrators quickly and reliably plan application migration projects by automatically identifying applications running in on-premises data centers, their associated dependencies, and their performance profile.

items.description: Walks through how to set up the AWS Application Discovery Service and integrate it with other services.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for the AWS Application Discovery Service in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

shortDescription: Automate application migration and modernization
detailDescription: AWS Application Migration Service (MGN) is a highly automated lift-and-shift solution that simplifies and expedites migration to AWS.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Learn how to set up and use AWS Application Migration Service.

items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS Application Migration Service in detail.

shortDescription: Accelerate app development with fully-managed, scalable GraphQL APIs
detailDescription: AWS AppSync is an enterprise-level, fully managed API management service that connects applications to events, data, and AI models.
