items.name: AWS AppSync Events Developer Guide
items.description: AWS AppSync Events lets you easily broadcast real-time event data to millions of subscribers using secure and performant serverless WebSocket APIs, without needing to manage connections or resource scaling.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS AppSync in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web service protocols.

shortDescription: On-demand access to AWS compliance reports
detailDescription: AWS Artifact is a web service that enables you to download AWS security and compliance documents such as ISO certifications and SOC reports.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Describes key concepts of AWS Artifact and provides instructions for using the features of AWS Artifact.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS Artifact.

shortDescription: Audit your AWS usage to simplify how you assess risk and compliance
detailDescription: AWS Audit Manager helps you continuously audit your AWS usage to simplify how you manage risk and compliance with regulations and industry standards. AWS Audit Manager makes it easier to evaluate whether your policies, procedures, and activities—also known as controls—are operating as intended. The service offers prebuilt frameworks with controls that are mapped to well-known industry standards and regulations, full customization of frameworks and controls, and automated collection and organization of evidence as designed by each control requirement.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Describes the key concepts of AWS Audit Manager and provides detailed instructions for using the various features.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS Audit Manager in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web service protocols.

items.name: AWS CloudFormation User Guide for AWS Audit Manager
items.description: Documents the reference information for all AWS Audit Manager resource and property types that are supported by AWS CloudFormation.

items.name: AWS Audit Manager SDK for Java API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for the AWS SDK for JavaScript in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web service protocols.

items.name: AWS Audit Manager SDK for Python (Boto3)
items.description: Describes all of the classes included in the AWS Audit Manager SDK for Python.

items.name: AWS CLI Reference for AWS Audit Manager
items.description: Documents the AWS Audit Manager commands available in the AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI).

shortDescription: Enables automated exchange of EDI-based transactions
detailDescription: AWS B2B Data Interchange enables automated exchange of EDI-based business-critical transactions at cloud scale, with elasticity, and pay-as-you-go pricing.

items.name: AWS B2B Data Interchange User Guide
items.description: Describes all B2B Data Interchange concepts and provides instructions on using the various features with the console, the command line interface, and the AWS B2B Data Interchange API.

items.name: AWS B2B Data Interchange API Reference
items.description: Describes all API operations for AWS B2B Data Interchange in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web service protocols.

shortDescription: Centralized backup across AWS services
detailDescription: AWS Backup is a fully managed backup service that makes it easy to centralize and automate the backup of data across AWS services in the cloud as well as on premises.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS Backup, detailed instructions for using the various features, and a complete API reference for developers.

shortDescription: Run batch jobs at any scale
detailDescription: AWS Batch enables you to run batch computing workloads on the AWS Cloud. Batch computing is a common way for developers, scientists, and engineers to access large amounts of compute resources. AWS Batch removes the undifferentiated heavy lifting of configuring and managing the required infrastructure.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Describes key concepts of AWS Batch and provides instructions for using the features of AWS Batch.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS Batch in detail.

items.name: AWS Batch section of AWS CLI Reference
items.description: Documents the AWS Batch commands available in the AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI).

shortDescription: Find features that help you pay your bills and optimize your costs
detailDescription: AWS Billing and Cost Management is a service that provides features that helps you pay your bills and optimize your costs. Amazon Web Services bills your account for usage, which ensures that you pay only for what you use.

sections.name: AWS Billing and Cost Management User Guides

items.name: AWS Billing User Guide
items.description: Describes how to use the billing, payments, and cost organization features in the AWS Billing and Cost Management console. Features described in this guide include Bills, Payments, Tax Settings, Free Tier, Credits, Payment Profiles, Purchase Orders, Advance Pay, Cost Categories, Cost Allocation Tags, AWS Price List, and Consolidated Billing.

items.name: AWS Cost Management User Guide
items.description: Describes how to use the cost analysis, budgeting, and savings features in the AWS Billing and Cost Management console. Features described in this guide include Cost Explorer, AWS Budgets, Cost Anomaly Detection, Cost Optimization Hub, Recommendations, Reservations, and Savings Plans.

items.name: AWS Data Exports User Guide
items.description: Describes how to use the AWS Data Exports feature, integrated with the AWS Billing and Cost Management console.

items.name: Legacy AWS Cost and Usage Report
items.description: Provides information on the Legacy Cost and Usage Report feature.

items.name: Customer Carbon Footprint Tool Release Notes
items.description: Provides CCFT release details such as new features, updates, and fixes related to service, console, and calculation.

items.name: AWS Billing Conductor User Guide
items.description: Describes how to use the AWS Billing Conductor console. Use the AWS Billing Conductor to customize how your bill is calculated and allocated.

items.name: API Reference for AWS Billing and Cost Management
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS Billing and Cost Management features in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

items.name: API Reference for AWS Billing Conductor
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS Billing Conductor with descriptions. Provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

shortDescription: Collaborate and analyze collective datasets without sharing raw data
detailDescription: AWS Clean Rooms is an AWS service that helps multiple parties to join their data together in a secure collaboration workspace.

items.name: AWS Clean Rooms User Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS Clean Rooms and offers step-by-step instructions for creating collaborations and analyzing datasets.

items.name: AWS Clean Rooms API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS Clean Rooms in detail.

items.name: AWS Clean Rooms Machine Learning API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS Clean Rooms Machine Learning in detail.

items.name: AWS Clean Rooms SQL Reference
items.description: Describes the SQL language supported by AWS Clean Rooms.

shortDescription: Command line interface tool to manage AWS services
detailDescription: The AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI) is a unified tool that provides a consistent interface for interacting with all parts of Amazon Web Services. AWS CLI commands for different services are covered in the accompanying user guide, including descriptions, syntax, and usage examples.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Describes all the AWS CLI concepts and provides instructions on using the various features of the latest version of the AWS CLI. Version 2 contains all the latest and adds new features.

items.name: Command Reference
items.description: Describes the latest version of the AWS CLI in detail and provides basic syntax, options, and usage examples for each operation.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Describes all the AWS CLI concepts and provides instructions on using the various features of Version 1 of the AWS CLI. Version 1 is currently still updated but does not include all of the new features the latest version has.

items.name: Version 1 Command Reference
items.description: Describes Version 1 of the AWS CLI in detail and provides basic syntax, options, and usage examples for each operation.

items.name: AWS SDKs and Tools Reference Guide
items.description: AWS SDKs and Tools shared information including shared config and credential files, configuration and authentication settings, AWS Common Runtime (CRT) libraries, and maintenance and support.

items.name: AWS Code Examples Repository
items.description: A collection of code examples that describe how to build applications with AWS SDKs

shortDescription: Manage AWS and third-party cloud infrastructure with consistent APIs
detailDescription: AWS Cloud Control API (Cloud Control API) is a set of common application programming interfaces (APIs) that make it easy for developers and partners to manage the lifecycle of AWS and third-party services. Cloud Control API provides five operations for developers to create, read, update, delete, and list (CRUDL) their cloud infrastructure.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS Cloud Control API and includes instructions on using the various features with the command line interface.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS Cloud Control API in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

items.name: Cloud Control API in the AWS CLI Reference
items.description: Describes the AWS Cloud Control API commands that are available in the AWS CLI.

items.name: Supported resources (AWS Cloud Control API User Guide)
items.description: Lists the AWS resources currently available for use with AWS Cloud Control API.

items.name: Managing resources (AWS Cloud Control API User Guide)
items.description: Describes how AWS Cloud Control API users can use the AWS CloudFormation registry to manage the resources in their AWS account.

items.name: CloudFormation CLI User Guide for Extension Development
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview and detailed walkthroughs on using the CloudFormation CLI to model and provision your own private and public resources.

shortDescription: Migrate timing-critical uncompressed video workflows to the cloud
detailDescription: The AWS Cloud Digital Interface (CDI) SDK provides customers with the ability to migrate timing-critical uncompressed video workflows to the cloud, unlocking the agility and scalability of AWS deployments without the need to compromise on quality or latency.

items.name: AWS Cloud Digital Interface Software Development Kit User Guide
items.description: Describes the components and features that the AWS Cloud Digital Interface Software Development Kit provides and how to use them.

shortDescription: Service discovery for cloud resources
detailDescription: AWS Cloud Map lets you name and discover your cloud resources.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Provides an overview of AWS Cloud Map, detailed feature descriptions, and procedures for using the console.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS Cloud Map in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

items.name: AWS Cloud Map (service discovery) in the AWS CLI Reference
items.description: Describes the commands in the AWS CLI that you can use for AWS Cloud Map (listed under "servicediscovery"). Provides syntax, options, and usage examples for each command.

shortDescription: Write, run, and debug code on a cloud IDE
detailDescription: AWS Cloud9 is a cloud-based integrated development environment (IDE) that you use to write, run, and debug code.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Describes how to get started and use AWS Cloud9.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS Cloud9. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

items.name: AWS CLI Reference for AWS Cloud9
items.description: Describes the AWS CLI commands that you can use to create and manage AWS Cloud9 development environments.

shortDescription: Create and manage resources with templates
detailDescription: AWS CloudFormation enables you to create and provision AWS infrastructure deployments predictably and repeatedly. It helps you leverage AWS products such as Amazon EC2, Amazon Elastic Block Store, Amazon SNS, Elastic Load Balancing, and Auto Scaling to build highly reliable, highly scalable, cost-effective applications in the cloud without worrying about creating and configuring the underlying AWS infrastructure. AWS CloudFormation enables you to use a template file to create and delete a collection of resources together as a single unit (a stack).

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS CloudFormation and includes instructions on using the various features with the command line interface.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS CloudFormation in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

items.name: AWS CloudFormation in the AWS CLI Reference
items.description: Describes the AWS CloudFormation commands that are available in the AWS CLI.

items.name: AWS CloudFormation Command Line Interface (CLI) User Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview and detailed walkthroughs on using the CloudFormation CLI to model and provision both AWS and third-party extensions through CloudFormation.

items.name: Hooks User Guide
items.description: With CloudFormation Hooks, you can provide code that proactively inspects the configuration of your AWS resources before provisioning. If non-compliant resources are found, CloudFormation either fails the operation and prevents the resources from being provisioned, or emits a warning and allows the provisioning operation to continue.

items.name: AWS CloudFormation Guard User Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of the AWS CloudFormation Guard open-source policy-as-code evaluation tool. Includes walkthroughs for writing and testing policy rules and validating data against those rules.

shortDescription: Hardware-based key storage for regulatory compliance
detailDescription: AWS CloudHSM offers secure cryptographic key storage for customers by providing managed hardware security modules in the AWS Cloud.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Explains important concepts of AWS CloudHSM and documents advanced product features and command line tools.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes the API operations for AWS CloudHSM.

items.name: AWS CloudHSM in the AWS CLI Reference
items.description: Describes the AWS CloudHSM commands that are available in the AWS Command Line Interface.

shortDescription: Command line access to AWS resources and tools directly from a browser
detailDescription: AWS CloudShell is a browser-based shell that you can use to manage AWS services using the AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI) and a range of pre-installed development tools.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Provides instructions and tutorials for using AWS CloudShell features, describes how to manage user permissions, and includes information about the compute environment.

shortDescription: Track and monitor activities by users, roles, or AWS services
detailDescription: With AWS CloudTrail, you can monitor your AWS deployments in the cloud by getting a history of AWS API calls for your account, including API calls made by using the AWS Management Console, the AWS SDKs, the command line tools, and higher-level AWS services. You can also identify which users and accounts called AWS APIs for services that support CloudTrail, the source IP address from which the calls were made, and when the calls occurred. You can integrate CloudTrail into applications using the API, automate trail creation for your organization, check the status of your trails, and control how administrators turn CloudTrail logging on and off.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Provides detailed descriptions of product concepts and includes instructions for using CloudTrail features with both the console and the command line interface.

items.name: CloudTrail API Reference
items.description: Describes all API operations for creating and managing resources in AWS CloudTrail in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for supported web service protocols.

items.name: CloudTrail-Data API Reference
items.description: Describes all API operations for AWS CloudTrail event data in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for supported web service protocols.

items.name: Partner Onboarding Guide
items.description: This guide is for AWS Partners in the AWS Partner Network who want to onboard their applications and solutions to CloudTrail Lake, and let their customers integrate application events into CloudTrail Lake.

shortDescription: Artifact management for software development
detailDescription: AWS CodeArtifact is a secure, scalable, and cost-effective artifact management service for software development.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Describes how to use AWS CodeArtifact to create repositories and use them to share packages and their assets.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes the API operations for AWS CodeArtifact. Also provides details of related request and response syntax and errors.

items.name: AWS CLI Reference for AWS CodeArtifact
items.description: Describes the AWS CLI commands that you can use to manage domains, repositories, and packages.

shortDescription: Build and test code
detailDescription: AWS CodeBuild is a fully managed build service that compiles your source code, runs unit tests, and produces artifacts that are ready to deploy.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Describes how you can use AWS CodeBuild, an AWS service that builds your software applications in the AWS cloud.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes the API operations for AWS CodeBuild. Also provides details of related request and response syntax and errors.

items.name: AWS CLI reference for AWS CodeBuild
items.description: Describes the AWS CLI commands that you can use to automate building your source code.

shortDescription: Automate code deployments
detailDescription: AWS CodeDeploy is a deployment service that enables developers to automate the deployment of applications to instances and to update the applications as required.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Describes how to get started and deploy applications using AWS CodeDeploy.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS CodeDeploy. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

items.name: AWS CLI Reference for AWS CodeDeploy
items.description: Describes the AWS CLI commands that you can use to automate deployments.

shortDescription: Release software using continuous delivery
detailDescription: AWS CodePipeline is a continuous delivery service that enables you to model, visualize, and automate the steps required to release your software.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Walks through how to set up AWS CodePipeline and integrate it with other services.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS CodePipeline in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

items.name: AWS CLI Reference for AWS CodePipeline
items.description: Describes the AWS CLI commands that you can use to manage your assets.

shortDescription: Identify optimal AWS compute resources
detailDescription: AWS Compute Optimizer recommends optimal AWS compute resources for your workloads. It can help you reduce costs and improve performance, by using machine learning to analyze your historical utilization metrics. Compute Optimizer helps you choose the optimal resource configuration based on your utilization data.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Describes key concepts of AWS Compute Optimizer and provides instructions to opt in and view your recommendations.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes the API operations for AWS Compute Optimizer. It also provides the basic structure and elements of an API request and response.

shortDescription: Track and evaluate configuration changes
detailDescription: AWS Config provides a detailed view of the resources associated with your AWS account, including how they are configured, how they are related to one another, and how the configurations and their relationships have changed over time.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS Config and includes detailed development instructions for using the various features.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS Config in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

items.name: CLI Reference
items.description: Documents the AWS Config command line interface.

shortDescription: View and manage resources to support incident response while on the go
detailDescription: The AWS Console Mobile Application, provided by Amazon Web Services, lets you view and manage a select set of resources to stay informed and connected with your AWS resources on-the-go.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of the AWS Console Mobile Application and includes detailed instructions for using the application.

shortDescription: Set up and govern a secure, compliant multi-account environment
detailDescription: AWS Control Tower is a service that enables you to enforce and manage governance rules for security, operations, and compliance at scale across all your organizations and accounts in the AWS Cloud.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Describes key concepts for AWS Control Tower. Provides instructions for setting up and using a landing zone, a secure and compliant multi-account AWS environment for enterprises or organizations at scale.

items.name: Security Information
items.description: Provides security and compliance details for AWS control catalog users.

items.name: Controls Reference Guide
items.description: Describes key concepts and reference pages for working with Control Tower controls to create a secure and compliant multi-account environment for enterprises or organizations at scale.

items.name: AWS Control Tower API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS Control Tower in detail. Also provides details of request and response syntax errors for the supported web services protocols.

items.name: Control Catalog API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for the control catalog that is part of AWS Control Tower, in detail. Also provides details of request and response syntax errors for the supported web services protocols.

shortDescription: Find, subscribe to, and use third-party data in the cloud
detailDescription: AWS Data Exchange is a service that makes it easy for customers to find, subscribe to, and use third-party data in the AWS Cloud.

items.name: AWS Data Exchange User Guide
items.description: Describes key concepts for AWS Data Exchange and provides instructions for providing, subscribing, and working with data sets. Data products are available to subscribers on AWS Marketplace as well as the AWS Data Exchange console. Data products can be published by providers using the AWS Data Exchange console and updated using AWS Marketplace Catalog API. Customers can use the AWS Data Exchange API or console to create, view, manage, and access data sets.

items.name: AWS Data Exchange API Reference
items.description: Documents the AWS Data Exchange API used to create, view, manage, and access data sets.

items.name: AWS Marketplace Catalog API Reference
items.description: The AWS Marketplace Catalog API Service provides an API interface for approved providers to programmatically manage their products. This includes the self-service publishing capabilities on AWS Marketplace.

shortDescription: Orchestration service for periodic, data-driven workflows
detailDescription: AWS Data Pipeline is a web service that you can use to automate the movement and transformation of data. With AWS Data Pipeline, you can define data-driven workflows, so that tasks can be dependent on the successful completion of previous tasks.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS Data Pipeline and includes detailed development instructions for using the various features.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS Data Pipeline in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

shortDescription: Migrate databases with minimal downtime
detailDescription: AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) is a web service you can use to migrate data from your database that is on-premises, on an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) DB instance, or in a database on an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance to a database on an AWS service. These services can include a database on Amazon RDS or a database on an Amazon EC2 instance. You can also migrate a database from an AWS service to an on-premises database. You can migrate between source and target endpoints that use the same database engine, such as from an Oracle database to an Oracle database. You can also migrate between source and target endpoints that use different database engines, such as from an Oracle database to a PostgreSQL database.

items.name: Data Migration Guide
items.description: Provides a high-level overview of AWS DMS concepts. Includes instructions on migrating data and replicating ongoing changes from relational databases, data warehouses, NoSQL databases, and other types of data stores into the AWS Cloud.

items.name: Fleet Advisor Guide
items.description: Describes how to plan database migrations with Fleet Advisor. Shows how to discover and assess on-premises databases, collect performance metrics in your inventory, and generate target recommendations for a migration to AWS.

items.name: Schema Conversion Guide
items.description: Describes how to assess the complexity of a database migration to a new target in the AWS Cloud. Explains how to automatically convert your source database schema and code objects to a format that is compatible with the new target database.

items.name: AWS DMS Step-by-Step Database Migration Guide
items.description: Provides step-by-step walkthroughs that go through the process of migrating data to AWS. The source or target database must be on an AWS service.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS Database Migration Service in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

items.name: AWS DMS section of the AWS CLI Reference
items.description: Documents the AWS CLI commands for AWS Database Migration Service.

shortDescription: Simple, fast, online data transfer
detailDescription: AWS DataSync is an online data movement and discovery service that simplifies data migration and helps you quickly, easily, and securely transfer your file or object data to, from, and between AWS storage services.

items.name: AWS DataSync User Guide
items.description: Describes AWS DataSync concepts and provides instructions on using the service's features with the DataSync console, AWS Command Line Interface, and DataSync API.

items.name: AWS DataSync in the AWS CLI Reference
items.description: Describes the AWS CLI commands that you can use with DataSync transfers and storage discovery.

shortDescription: Simplified render management and scalable infrastructure for rendering projects
detailDescription: AWS Deadline Cloud provides you with infrastructure and centralized management for your rendering projects.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Provides tutorials and concepts about AWS Deadline Cloud, including how to install, configure, and use various features in the console and monitor.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS Deadline Cloud and includes detailed development instructions for using the various features.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all API operations for AWS Deadline Cloud in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web service protocols.

shortDescription: Deep learning on Amazon EC2
detailDescription: The AWS Deep Learning AMIs equip machine learning practitioners and researchers with the infrastructure and tools to accelerate deep learning in the cloud at any scale. You can quickly launch Amazon EC2 instances on Amazon Linux or Ubuntu, preinstalled with popular deep learning frameworks. Examples include Apache MXNet and Gluon, TensorFlow, the Microsoft Cognitive Toolkit (CNTK), Caffe, Caffe2, Theano, Torch and Keras. You can use these frameworks to train sophisticated, custom AI models; experiment with new algorithms; or to learn new skills and techniques.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Helps you launch and use the Deep Learning AMI (DLAMI). This guide covers several use cases that are common for deep learning for both training and inference. Learn how to choose the right AMI and the type of instances for your purpose.

shortDescription: Autonomous 1/18th scale race car, driven by ML
detailDescription: AWS DeepRacer is a reinforcement learning (RL)-enabled autonomous 1/18th-scale vehicle with supporting services in the AWS Machine Learning ecosystem. It offers an interactive learning system for users of all levels to acquire and refine their skill set in machine learning in general, and reinforcement learning in particular. You can use the AWS DeepRacer console to train and evaluate deep reinforcement learning models in simulation and then deploy them to an AWS DeepRacer vehicle for autonomous driving. You can also join the AWS DeepRacer League to race in the online Virtual Circuit or the in-person events.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Learn how to train and evaluate a reinforcement learning model for autonomous driving in simulation. The tasks include how define a reward function, customize the action space, set up the training configuration, and creating a training job using Amazon SageMaker and AWS RoboMaker. Find out how to submit a trained model to the AWS DeepRacer League to race against other AWS DeepRacer users in the online Virtual Circuit. Learn how to set up and calibrate your AWS DeepRacer vehicle, upload a trained AWS DeepRacer model to the vehicle, build a physical track for the vehicle to drive autonomously.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: AWS DeepRacer Student is a free service for students currently enrolled in high school or a university or community college. Using AWS DeepRacer, you can train a reinforcement learning model that will attempt to drive autonomously around a racetrack. The AWS DeepRacer Student League is a place where you can join up with your friends and compete for prizes. Students also have the opportunity to win Udacity scholarships through the AWS AI & ML Scholarship program.

shortDescription: Test Android, iOS, and web apps on real devices in the AWS Cloud
detailDescription: AWS Device Farm is an app testing service that enables you to test your iOS, Android and Fire OS apps on real, physical phones and tablets that are hosted by AWS. The service allows you to upload your own tests or use built-in, script-free compatibility tests.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of Device Farm and includes detailed instructions for using the service.

items.name: Guide for Desktop Browser Testing
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview and detailed instructions for testing desktop web applications with Device Farm.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the Device Farm operations in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

shortDescription: Dedicated network connection to AWS
detailDescription: AWS Direct Connect establishes a dedicated network connection between your on-premises network and AWS. With this connection in place, you can create virtual interfaces directly to the AWS Cloud, bypassing your internet service provider. This can provide a more consistent network experience.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Describes key concepts and provides instructions for using the features of AWS Direct Connect.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes the API operations for AWS Direct Connect.

items.name: Direct Connect section of the AWS CLI Reference
items.description: Describes the AWS CLI commands for AWS Direct Connect.

shortDescription: Set up and run Microsoft Active Directory with AWS services
detailDescription: AWS Directory Service provides multiple ways to set up and run Microsoft Active Directory with other AWS services such as Amazon EC2, Amazon RDS for SQL Server, FSx for Windows File Server, and AWS IAM Identity Center. AWS Directory Service for Microsoft Active Directory, also known as AWS Managed Microsoft AD, enables your directory-aware workloads and AWS resources to use a managed Active Directory in the AWS Cloud.

sections.name: Choose from any of the following directories:

items.name: AWS Managed Microsoft AD
items.description: AWS Managed Microsoft AD is a Microsoft Active Directory hosted on the AWS Cloud. It integrates most Active Directory features with AWS applications.

items.name: AD Connector
items.description: AD Connector uses your existing on-premises Microsoft Active Directory to access AWS applications and services.

items.name: Directory Service Administration Guide
items.description: Describes how to create and manage an AWS Directory Service directory.

items.name: Directory Service API Reference
items.description: Describes the API operations for AWS Directory Service.

items.name: AWS Directory Service Data API Reference
items.description: Describes the API operations for AWS Directory Service Data.

items.name: AWS Directory Service in the AWS CLI
items.description: Describes the Directory Service commands in the AWS Command Line Interface.

shortDescription: Run and manage web apps
detailDescription: With AWS Elastic Beanstalk, you can quickly deploy and manage applications in the AWS Cloud without worrying about the infrastructure that runs those applications. AWS Elastic Beanstalk reduces management complexity without restricting choice or control. You simply upload your application, and AWS Elastic Beanstalk automatically handles the details of capacity provisioning, load balancing, scaling, and application health monitoring.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Read conceptual and detailed instructions for using AWS Elastic Beanstalk to quickly deploy and manage applications in the AWS cloud without worrying about the infrastructure that runs those applications.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Get formal descriptions of all the API operations for AWS Elastic Beanstalk. In addition, find sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

items.name: Getting Started Walkthrough
items.description: Walks developers through the use of the console to create, view, deploy, and update an application for the first time, as well as the steps for editing and terminating an environment.

items.name: Getting Started Tutorials
items.description: Get started using any of the following application environments: Docker, Python, PHP, Node.js, .NET, Ruby, or Java.

items.name: Platforms
items.description: Find detailed listings of current AWS Elastic Beanstalk platform versions. Also find lists of historical platform versions and the date ranges they were current.

items.name: Release Notes
items.description: Find details about AWS Elastic Beanstalk releases—new features, updates, and fixes related to the service, platform, console, and EB CLI.

shortDescription: Scalable, cost-effective application recovery to AWS
detailDescription: AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery (AWS DRS) minimizes downtime and data loss with fast, reliable recovery of on-premises and cloud-based applications using affordable storage, minimal compute, and point-in-time recovery.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Learn how to set up and use AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery.

items.name: API Reference

shortDescription: Reliable and secure live video transport
detailDescription: AWS Elemental MediaConnect is a reliable, secure, and flexible transport service for live video. Using AWS Elemental MediaConnect, broadcasters and content owners can cost-effectively send high-value live content into the cloud, securely transmit it to partners for distribution, and replicate it to multiple destinations around the globe.

detailDescription: AWS Elemental MediaConvert is a service that formats and compresses offline video content for delivery to televisions or connected devices. High-quality video transcoding makes it possible to create on-demand video assets for virtually any device.

detailDescription: AWS Elemental MediaStore is a video origination and storage service that offers the high performance, predictable low latency, and immediate consistency required for live origination. detailDescription: AWS Elemental MediaTailor is a personalization and monetization service that allows scalable server-side ad insertion. The service also enables you to track ad views for accurate ad reporting.

shortDescription: Serverless compute for containers
detailDescription: AWS Fargate is a technology that you can use with Amazon ECS to run containers without having to manage servers or clusters of Amazon EC2 instances. With AWS Fargate, you no longer have to provision, configure, or scale clusters of virtual machines to run containers. This removes the need to choose server types, decide when to scale your clusters, or optimize cluster packing.

detailDescription: AWS Fault Injection Service (AWS FIS) is a managed service that enables you to perform fault injection experiments on your AWS workloads.

shortDescription: Deploy network security across your VPCs with just a few clicks
detailDescription: AWS Firewall Manager simplifies your AWS WAF administration and maintenance tasks across multiple accounts and resources. With AWS Firewall Manager, you set up your firewall rules just once. The service automatically applies your rules across your accounts and resources, even as you add new resources.

shortDescription: Improve global application availability and performance
detailDescription: AWS Global Accelerator is a network layer service in which you create accelerators to improve the security, availability, and performance of your applications for local and global users. Depending on the type of accelerator that you choose, you can gain additional benefits, such as improving availability or mapping users to specific destination endpoints.

detailDescription: AWS Glue is a scalable, serverless data integration service that makes it easy to discover, prepare, and combine data for analytics, machine learning, and application development.

shortDescription: Move sensitive workloads into the cloud
detailDescription: The AWS GovCloud (US) Regions are isolated AWS Regions designed to enable U.S. government agencies and customers to move sensitive workloads into the cloud by addressing their specific regulatory and compliance requirements. The AWS GovCloud (US) Regions adhere to U.S. International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Provides information about setting up your AWS GovCloud (US) account, identifies the differences between the AWS GovCloud (US) Regions and other AWS Regions, and defines usage guidelines for processing export-controlled data within the AWS GovCloud (US) Regions.

shortDescription: Fully managed ground station as a service
detailDescription: AWS Ground Station is a fully managed service that enables you to control satellite communications, process satellite data, and scale your satellite operations. With AWS Ground Station, you don't have to build or manage your own ground station infrastructure.

shortDescription: Securely manage access to services and resources with IAM
detailDescription: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) is a web service for securely controlling access to AWS services. With IAM, you can centrally manage users, security credentials such as access keys, and permissions that control which AWS resources users and applications can access.

detailDescription: ExpressLink hardware modules are pre-programmed to connect to AWS IoT services and are pre-loaded with security credentials. They allow original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) to connect many different products to the cloud, send data and commands using simple commands, and use AWS services to address their data storage, analytics, and machine learning (ML) needs.

Customers can use AWS IoT Device Management to onboard device information and configuration, organize their device inventory, monitor their fleet of devices, and remotely manage devices deployed across many locations. This remote management includes over-the-air (OTA) updates to device software.

AWS IoT Greengrass minimizes the cost of transmitting data to the cloud by enabling you to author custom software and AWS Lambda functions that run on local devices.

items.description: Share your data lakes in a scalable way using fine-grained access for internal and external customers from a centralized location.

shortDescription: Run code without thinking about servers
detailDescription: With AWS Lambda, you can run code without provisioning or managing servers. You pay only for the compute time that you consume—there's no charge when your code isn't running. You can run code for virtually any type of application or backend service—all with zero administration. Just upload your code and Lambda takes care of everything required to run and scale your code with high availability.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS Lambda, detailed instructions for using the various features, and a complete API reference for developers.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes in detail all the API operations for AWS Lambda.

items.name: Serverless Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of serverless development in the AWS Cloud, fundamental instructions for core serverless AWS services, and related learning resources for developers.

items.name: Serverless Land
items.description: Brings together the latest blogs, videos, code, and learning resources for serverless AWS services.

shortDescription: Easily size, configure, and deploy third-party applications on AWS
detailDescription: AWS Launch Wizard helps you reduce the time that it takes to deploy application and domain-controller solutions to the cloud. You provide your application or domain controller requirements, and AWS Launch Wizard identifies the right AWS resources to deploy and run your solution. AWS Launch Wizard estimates the cost of the deployment, lets you modify your resources, and then view the updated cost assessment. Then, after you approve, AWS Launch Wizard provisions and configures the selected resources in a few hours to create fully-functioning, production-ready applications or domain controllers. It also creates custom AWS CloudFormation templates, which you can reuse and customize for subsequent deployments.

items.name: Active Directory User Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS Launch Wizard for Active Directory, and includes detailed instructions for how to get started.

items.name: EKS User Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS Launch Wizard for EKS, and includes detailed instructions for how to get started.

items.name: SAP User Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS Launch Wizard for SAP, and includes detailed instructions for how to get started.

items.name: SQL Server User Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS Launch Wizard for SQL Server, and includes detailed instructions for how to get started.

shortDescription: Track and manage software licenses across multiple AWS Regions
detailDescription: AWS License Manager streamlines the process of bringing software vendor licenses to the AWS Cloud. As you build out cloud infrastructure on AWS, you can save costs by repurposing your existing license inventory for use with cloud resources. License Manager reduces the risk of licensing overages and penalties with inventory tracking that is tied directly to AWS resources.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Describes key concepts of AWS License Manager and provides instructions for using the features of AWS License Manager.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Provides descriptions, syntax, and usage examples for each of the API actions and data types for AWS License Manager.

shortDescription: Migrate, modernize, operate, and run mainframe workloads
detailDescription: AWS Mainframe Modernization provides tools and resources to help you plan and implement migration and modernization from mainframes to AWS managed runtime environments.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes in detail all the API operations for AWS Mainframe Modernization.

items.name: Application Testing API Reference
items.description: Describes in detail all the API operations for AWS Mainframe Modernization Application Testing.

shortDescription: Infrastructure operations management for AWS
detailDescription: AWS Managed Services (AMS) helps you operate AWS more efficiently and securely. Leveraging AWS services and a growing library of automations, configurations, and run books, AMS can augment and optimize your operational capabilities in both new and existing AWS environments.

items.name: AMS Accelerate User Guide
items.description: Information about using the AWS Managed Services Accelerate operations plan for providing operational capabilities such as monitoring, incident management, security guidance, patch support, and backup for new or existing AWS workloads. Includes getting started information.

items.name: AMS Advanced User Guide
items.description: Information about using the AWS Managed Services Advanced operations plan for both multi-account landing zone and single-account landing zone users. This includes an overview of the services AMS provides, details on using the Advanced operations plan, and information about requests for change (RFCs) and change types.

items.name: AMS Advanced Onboarding Guide
items.description: Information about onboarding to the AWS Managed Services Advanced operations plan for both multi-account landing zone and single-account landing zone users, including questions, considerations, and service overviews.

items.name: AMS Advanced Application Developers Guide
items.description: Information about developing applications within the AWS Managed Services Advanced operations plan environment. This includes details about application migration with Workload Ingest or CFN Template migration, and a quick start section for multi-procedure tasks.

items.name: AMS Change Type Reference
items.description: Reference information about change types in the AWS Managed Services Advanced operations plan, including console and CLI usage examples for each change type.

items.name: AMS Change Management API Reference
items.description: Reference information for the change management API in the AWS Managed Services Advanced operations plan.

shortDescription: Web-based user interface comprising multiple AWS service consoles
detailDescription: The AWS Management Console is a web-based application that contains and provides centralized access to all individual AWS service consoles. You can use Unified Navigation in the AWS Management Console to search for services, view notifications, access AWS CloudShell, access account and billing information, and customize your general console settings. The home page of the AWS Management Console is called AWS Console Home. From AWS Console Home, you can manage your AWS applications and access all other individual service consoles. You can also customize AWS Console Home to show other helpful information about AWS and your resources by using widgets. You can add, remove, and rearrange widgets such as Recently visited, AWS Health, and more.

shortDescription: Buy or sell software that runs on AWS
detailDescription: AWS Marketplace is an online store where you can buy or sell software that runs on Amazon Web Services.

items.name: Seller Guide
items.description: Describes how to use AWS Marketplace to list your products that run on Amazon Web Services products and services.

items.name: Buyer Guide
items.description: Describes how to use AWS Marketplace to find, test, buy, and deploy software that runs on Amazon Web Services.

items.name: AWS Marketplace API Reference
items.description: Describes how sellers can use the various AWS Marketplace service APIs to integrate and manage their product lifecycles and offers. Describes how AWS Marketplace buyers can use the various AWS Marketplace service APIs to integrate with discovery and governance of third-party software, data, and services.

shortDescription: Reduce time and effort to convert large applications to microservices
detailDescription: Reduce the skill bar and effort required to transform monolithic applications into smaller and independent services that improve uptime and reduce operational costs.

items.name: AWS Microservice Extractor for .NET User Guide
items.description: Describes key concepts of Microservice Extractor, and provides instructions for using the features of Microservice Extractor.

shortDescription: Track migrations from a single place
detailDescription: AWS Migration Hub (Migration Hub) provides a single location to track migration tasks across multiple AWS tools and partner solutions. With Migration Hub, you can choose the AWS and partner migration tools that best fit your needs while providing visibility into the status of your migration projects. Migration Hub also provides key metrics and progress information for individual applications, regardless of which tools are used to migrate them.

items.name: Migration Hub User Guide
items.description: Walks through how to set up Migration Hub and integrate it with other services and includes the API reference.

items.name: AWS Migration Hub Journeys User Guide
items.description: AWS Migration Hub Journeys is a service that you can use to plan, perform, and track migrations into AWS.

items.name: Migration Hub API Reference
items.description: Describes the API operations available for Migration Hub along with sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

items.name: Migration Hub Home Region API Reference
items.description: Describes the API operations available for Migration Hub Home Region along with sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

items.name: Migration Launch Guide
items.description: This guide provides resources that are commonly used by customers when migrating to AWS.

items.name: Refactor Spaces User Guide
items.description: Walks through how to set up Refactor Spaces as the starting point for incremental application refactoring to microservices.

items.name: Refactor Spaces API Reference
items.description: Describes the API operations available for Refactor Spaces along with sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

items.name: Strategy Recommendations User Guide
items.description: Walks through how to set up Strategy Recommendations to help you plan migration and modernization initiatives by offering migration and modernization strategy recommendations for viable transformation paths for your applications.

items.name: Strategy Recommendations API Reference

items.name: Orchestrator API Reference
items.description: Describes the API operations available for Orchestrator along with sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

shortDescription: Deploy network security across your Amazon VPCs with just a few clicks
detailDescription: AWS Network Firewall is a stateful, managed, network firewall and intrusion detection and prevention service for your virtual private cloud (VPC).

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes the AWS Network Firewall API operations in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

shortDescription: Automate operations with Chef and Puppet
detailDescription: AWS OpsWorks provides a simple and flexible way to create and manage stacks and applications. With AWS OpsWorks, you can provision AWS resources, manage their configuration, deploy applications to those resources, and monitor their health.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Provides detailed descriptions of AWS OpsWorks Stacks, AWS OpsWorks for Chef Automate, and AWS OpsWorks for Puppet Enterprise concepts, and provides instructions for using both the console and the command line interface.

items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS OpsWorks Stacks in detail. In addition, it provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

items.description: Describes the API operations for AWS OpsWorks CM—including AWS OpsWorks for Chef Automate and AWS OpsWorks for Puppet Enterprise—in detail. In addition, it provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

shortDescription: Central governance and management across AWS accounts
detailDescription: With AWS Organizations, you can consolidate multiple AWS accounts into an organization that you create and centrally manage. You can create member accounts and invite existing accounts to join your organization. You can organize those accounts and manage them as a group. With AWS Account Management you can update the alternate contact information for each of your AWS accounts.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Introduces you to AWS Organizations, helps you set up an organization by creating accounts or inviting other accounts to join. It shows you how to manage your accounts as a group and provide organization-wide access control to your AWS resources by using policy-based controls.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS Organizations in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

items.name: AWS Account Management Reference Guide
items.description: Introduces you to creating and managing your individual AWS accounts. It includes detailed descriptions of the API operations, including sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

shortDescription: Run AWS infrastructure on-premises
detailDescription: AWS Outposts brings native AWS services, infrastructure, and operating models to virtually any data center, co-location space, or on-premises facility. You can use the same services, tools, and partner solutions to develop for the cloud and on premises.

shortDescription: Improve your operations with computer vision at the edge
detailDescription: With AWS Panorama, companies can use compute power at the edge, without requiring video streamed to the cloud, to improve their operations by automating monitoring and visual inspection tasks like evaluating manufacturing quality, finding bottlenecks in industrial processes, and assessing worker safety within their facilities.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS Panorama and detailed instructions for using its features.

items.name: API Reference

detailDescription: AWS ParallelCluster is an AWS supported open source cluster management tool that helps you to deploy and manage high performance computing (HPC) clusters in the AWS Cloud.

items.description: Describes key concepts of AWS ParallelCluster and provides instructions for using its features.

items.name: User Guide (v2)
items.description: Describes key concepts of AWS ParallelCluster and provides instructions for using its features.

detailDescription: Create and host payment processing applications using cloud-native payment cryptography and key management with AWS Payment Cryptography.

shortDescription: Create cost estimates that match your AWS use case
detailDescription: AWS provides a public Pricing Calculator website and an in-console Pricing Calculator experience so that you can generate estimates for your specific workloads or applications. The public calculator is accessible to anyone, including those without an AWS account. The in-console calculator is available exclusively to AWS account holders, including standalone accounts and those within an AWS organization (member and management accounts).

items.name: In-Console AWS Pricing Calculator User Guide (Preview)
items.description: Describes how to use the in-console AWS Pricing Calculator so that you can create estimates using discounts and purchase commitments.

items.name: Public AWS Pricing Calculator User Guide
items.description: Describes how to use the public AWS Pricing Calculator website so that you can create estimates with On-Demand pricing.

shortDescription: Create private certificates to identify resources and protect data
detailDescription: AWS Private Certificate Authority (AWS Private CA ) is a hosted private certificate authority service to issue and revoke digital certificates deployed in your organization's private PKI, including on AWS managed resources and in the Internet of Things.

items.name: User Guide

shortDescription: Automate management for container and serverless deployments
detailDescription: AWS Proton creates and manages standardized infrastructure and deployment tooling for developers and their serverless and container-based applications.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Provides an overview of AWS Proton and how your team can use it to create and manage infrastructure and deployment tools for your cloud services or applications.

shortDescription: Build an organization-specific knowledge resource for your cloud community
detailDescription: AWS re:Post Private is a private version of AWS re:Post for enterprises with Enterprise Support or Enterprise On-Ramp Support plans. It provides access to knowledge and experts to accelerate cloud adoption and increase developer productivity. With your organization-specific private re:Post, you can build an organization-specific developer community that drives efficiencies at scale and provides access to valuable knowledge resources. Additionally, re:Post Private centralizes trusted AWS technical content and offers private discussion forums to improve how your teams collaborate internally and with AWS to remove technical obstacles, accelerate innovation, and scale more efficiently in the cloud.

items.name: Console Administration Guide
items.description: Helps you get started with AWS re:Post Private. Learn how to quickly and easily provision and maintain one or more organization-specific private re:Posts in the re:Post Private console.

items.name: Administration Guide
items.description: Helps you get started with customizing your private re:Post according to your organizational branding and knowledge needs. Learn how to set up and maintain your private re:Post.

items.name: User Guide

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes the API operations for AWS re:Post Private in detail. The API Reference also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for supported web service protocols.

shortDescription: Prepare and protect your applications from disruptions
detailDescription: AWS Resilience Hub helps you proactively prepare and protect your AWS applications from disruptions. AWS Resilience Hub provides resiliency assessment and validation to help you identify and resolve issues before releasing applications into production.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Describes how to use AWS Resilience Hub to analyze your infrastructure, get recommendations to improve the resiliency of your AWS apps, review resiliency scores, and more.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the AWS Resilience Hub API operations in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services protocols.

shortDescription: Develop, test, and deploy robotics applications
detailDescription: AWS RoboMaker is a service that makes it easy to develop, simulate, and deploy intelligent robotics applications at scale.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS RoboMaker, instructions for managing robots, simulations and fleets, and includes a complete API reference for developers.

shortDescription: Build serverless applications on AWS
detailDescription: The AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM) is an open-source framework that enables you to build serverless applications on AWS. It provides you with a template specification to define your serverless application, and a command line interface (CLI) tool.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Introduces you to AWS SAM, and shows you how to use AWS SAM to define, test, and deploy serverless applications.

items.name: Template Specification
items.description: Describes the open-source specification that you use to define serverless applications.

shortDescription: Convert source schema and most code to target-compatible format
detailDescription: The AWS Schema Conversion Tool makes heterogeneous database migrations easy by automatically converting the source database schema and a majority of the custom code to a format compatible with the target database. The custom code that the tool converts includes views, stored procedures, and functions. Any code that the tool cannot convert automatically is clearly marked so that you can convert it yourself. For supported source and target databases, see the User Guide, following.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Describes AWS Schema Conversion Tool concepts and provides instructions on installing the tool, creating projects, generating the database migration assessment report, and converting schema from your source database to your target Amazon RDS DB instance.

shortDescription: Develop applications with .NET-specific APIs and libraries
detailDescription: The SDK for .NET makes it easier for Windows developers to build .NET applications that tap into cost-effective, scalable, and reliable AWS infrastructure services such as Amazon S3, Amazon EC2, and Amazon DynamoDB.

items.name: Developer Guide

shortDescription: Rotate, manage, and retrieve secrets
detailDescription: AWS Secrets Manager helps you to securely encrypt, store, and retrieve credentials for your databases and other services. Instead of hardcoding credentials in your apps, you can make calls to Secrets Manager to retrieve your credentials whenever needed. Secrets Manager helps you protect access to your IT resources and data by enabling you to rotate and manage access to your secrets.

items.name: User Guide
items.description: Walks you through creating and managing your secrets, retrieving them in your application, and automatically rotating them to help keep them secure.

items.name: API Reference

shortDescription: Unified security and compliance center
detailDescription: AWS Security Hub provides you with a comprehensive view of the security state of your AWS resources. Security Hub collects security data from across AWS accounts and services, and helps you analyze your security trends to identify and prioritize the security issues across your AWS environment.

items.name: AWS Security Hub User Guide
items.description: Describes how to set up, configure, and use AWS Security Hub to evaluate the security and compliance state of your AWS environment.

items.name: AWS Security Hub API Reference
items.description: Describes all of the API operations for AWS Security Hub.

items.description: Describes how AWS Partner Network (APN) Partners set up an integration with AWS Security Hub.

shortDescription: Helps you respond to and receive CIRT assistance for security events
detailDescription: AWS Security Incident Response helps organizations quickly prepare for, respond to, and recover from security incidents.

shortDescription: Discover, deploy, and publish serverless applications
detailDescription: The AWS Serverless Application Repository is a managed repository for serverless applications. It enables teams, organizations, and individual developers to find, deploy, publish, share, store, and easily assemble serverless architectures.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS Serverless Application Repository, includes detailed instructions for using features, and provides a complete API reference for developers.

shortDescription: Create and use standardized products
detailDescription: AWS Service Catalog enables IT administrators to create, manage, and distribute portfolios of approved products to end users, who can then access the products they need in a personalized portal. Typical products include servers, databases, websites, or applications that are deployed using AWS resources (for example, an Amazon EC2 instance or an Amazon RDS database). You can control which users have access to specific products to enforce compliance with organizational business standards, manage product lifecycles, and help users find and launch products with confidence.

items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS Service Catalog and includes detailed instructions for using the service as an administrator.

shortDescription: Provision, manage, and operate AWS resources within ITSM tools
detailDescription: AWS Service Management Connector (SMC) enables users to provision, manage, and operate AWS resources and capabilities in familiar IT Service Management (ITSM) tooling (for example, ServiceNow and Atlassian). These integrations enable organizations to migrate and adopt AWS faster and at-scale. With AWS Service Management Connector, you can manage and govern AWS resources directly through your organization's existing operations management tool and system of record.

items.name: AWS Service Management Connector Documentation
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of AWS Service Management Connector and instructions for using the service as an administrator.

shortDescription: DDoS protection
detailDescription: AWS provides two levels of protection against DDoS attacks: AWS Shield Standard and AWS Shield Advanced. AWS Shield Standard is automatically included at no extra cost beyond what you already pay for AWS WAF and your other AWS services. For added protection against DDoS attacks, AWS offers AWS Shield Advanced. AWS Shield Advanced provides expanded DDoS attack protection for your Amazon EC2 instances, Elastic Load Balancing load balancers, Amazon CloudFront distributions, and Amazon Route 53 hosted zones.

items.name: Developer Guide
items.description: Describes how to get started with AWS Shield Advanced. Explains key concepts, and provides step-by-step instructions that show you how to use the features.

items.name: API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS Shield Advanced in detail.

shortDescription: Find help signing in and out of your account
detailDescription: This guide helps you understand the different ways that you can sign in to Amazon Web Services (AWS), depending on what type of user you are. For more information about how to sign in based on your user type and the AWS resources that you want to access, see one of the following tutorials.

shortDescription: Validate AWS Lambda and IoT device code against a digital signature
detailDescription: With AWS Signer, you can cryptographically sign computer code for AWS Lambda applications and AWS-supported IoT devices.

shortDescription: Build and run large-scale spatial simulations in the AWS Cloud
detailDescription: AWS SimSpace Weaver distributes your workload across multiple instances. SimSpace Weaver manages the infrastructure and network communication between the instances that run your workload.

items.name: User Guide

shortDescription: Move petabytes of data to and from AWS, or process data at the edge
detailDescription: The AWS Snowball Edge devices help customers who need to run operations in austere, non-data center environments, and in locations where there's no consistent network connectivity. You can use these devices to locally and cost-effectively access the storage and compute power of the AWS Cloud in places where an internet connection might not be an option.

items.name: AWS Snowball Edge Developer Guide
items.description: Provides a conceptual overview of how to use an AWS Snowball Edge device. Includes guidance for local storage and compute, clustering, importing and exporting data into Amazon S3, and other device features. Device configuration options include storage optimized 210 TB and compute optimized.

items.name: AWS Snowball Edge API Reference
items.description: Describes all the API operations for AWS Snowball Edge in detail. Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web service protocols.

shortDescription: Coordination for distributed applications
detailDescription: AWS Step Functions makes it easy to coordinate the components of distributed applications as a series of steps in a visual workflow. You can quickly build and run state machines to execute the steps of your application in a reliable and scalable fashion.

shortDescription: Hybrid storage integration
detailDescription: AWS Storage Gateway is a service that connects an on-premises software appliance with cloud-based storage to provide seamless and secure integration between your on-premises IT environment and the AWS storage infrastructure in the AWS Cloud.

shortDescription: Reduce risks and lower costs with ML-powered supply chain application
detailDescription: AWS Supply Chain is a cloud-based application that works with your enterprise resource planning (ERP) and supply chain management systems. Using AWS Supply Chain, you can connect and extract your inventory, supply, and demand related data from existing ERP or supply chain systems into a single data model.

shortDescription: Automate the deployment and management of your telco networks on AWS
detailDescription: AWS Telco Network Builder (AWS TNB) is a managed 5G network automation service that enables communication service providers to rapidly deploy and cost-effectively manage their 5G networks on AWS.

shortDescription: Extension for hosted and on-premises Microsoft Azure DevOps
detailDescription: The AWS Toolkit for Azure DevOps contains tasks you can use in build and release definitions in Azure DevOps to interact with AWS services. The AWS Toolkit for Azure DevOps is available through the Visual Studio Marketplace.

shortDescription: Open-source plugin for the integrated development environments (IDEs) for JetBrains
detailDescription: The AWS Toolkit for JetBrains IDEs is an open source plug-in for the integrated development environments (IDEs) from JetBrains that makes it easier for developers to develop, debug, and deploy serverless applications that use Amazon Web Services. It includes features like credentials management and AWS Region management that simplify writing applications for Amazon Web Services.

items.name: User Guide

The AWS Toolkit for JetBrains is an open source plug-in for the integrated development environments (IDEs) from JetBrains that makes it easier for developers to develop, debug, and deploy applications that use AWS. This documentation is offered for free here as a Kindle book, or you can read it online or in PDF format on the AWS Documentation website.

shortDescription: PowerShell modules built on the functionality exposed by the SDK for .NET
detailDescription: AWS Tools for PowerShell and AWS Tools for PowerShell Core are PowerShell modules, built on functionality exposed by the SDK for .NET, that enable you to script operations on AWS resources from the PowerShell command line. Although you use the SDK's service clients and methods to implement the cmdlets, the cmdlets give you a PowerShell experience to specify parameters and handle results. For example, the cmdlets in both modules support PowerShell pipelining to pipe PowerShell objects to and from the cmdlets.

You can extend your existing on-premises network into a VPC, or connect to other AWS resources from a client. AWS VPN offers two types of private connectivity that feature the high availability and robust security necessary for your data.

shortDescription: Filter malicious web traffic
detailDescription: AWS WAF is a web application firewall that lets you monitor and manage web requests that are forwarded to protected AWS resources. With AWS WAF, you can protect resources such as Amazon CloudFront distributions, Amazon API Gateway REST APIs, Application Load Balancers, and AWS AppSync GraphQL APIs. You can use AWS WAF to inspect web requests for matches to conditions that you specify, such as the IP address that the requests originate from, the value of a specific request component, or the rate at which requests are being sent. AWS WAF can manage matching requests in a variety of ways, including counting them, blocking or allowing them, or sending challenges like CAPTCHA puzzles to the client user or browser.

Wavelength deploys standard AWS compute and storage services to the edge of telecommunication carriers' 5G networks. Developers can extend an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) to one or more Wavelength Zones, and then use AWS resources like Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instances to run applications that require ultra-low latency and a connection to AWS services in the Region.

shortDescription: Scalable, open-source deep learning framework
detailDescription: Apache MXNet (MXNet) is an open source deep learning framework that allows you to define, train, and deploy deep neural networks on a wide array of platforms, from cloud infrastructure to mobile devices. It is highly scalable, which allows for fast model training, and supports a flexible programming model and multiple languages. The MXNet library is portable and lightweight, and it scales seamlessly to run on multiple GPUs and across multiple machines. MXNet supports programming in various languages to build and train deep learning models. Languages include Python, R, Scala, Julia, and Perl.

service: AWS End-of-Support Migration Program (EMP) for Windows Server
shortDescription: Migrate legacy apps to AWS supported versions without code refactoring
detailDescription: The End-of-Support Migration Program for Windows Server (EMP) migrates legacy applications from Windows Server 2003, 2008, and 2008 R2 to newer, supported versions on AWS without any code refactoring. The EMP technology decouples the application from the existing operating system and packages it with all necessary application files and components. The program then replatforms it to a supported version of the Windows operating system on AWS. After the migration, any outdated API calls are redirected, enabling the application to run on the latest versions of the Windows OS.
